result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L Tracy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment with DOC. Comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified,  and comply with any recommendations.

miscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No contact with any Big Lots stores.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Absolute sobriety.   Random urine screens.

Pay all of following by end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Pay DNA surcharges, Court costs.  All applicable fees of supervision.   Bail to apply.
If revoked, costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Restitution set at zero.

timeConds.notes: Report date is 1/21/2016.  No good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald L Tracy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
1/13/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.
  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 60 days in the HOC, no good time.  Defendant's report date is 1/21/2016.
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 50 hours of community service
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Absolute sobriety
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- No contact with any Big Lots stores
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified and comly with any recommendations.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Sentecing Referral Form

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case mis-calendared for December 2016.  State has not had an opportunity to satisfy victim rights.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense is considering a motion to dismiss.    Court ordered case adjourned for soft projected guilty plea hearing in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Plaisted appears as new counsel.    Court ordered case adjourned for soft projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense motion withdraw heard and granted.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
At the request of the court, the hearing scheduled for 06/30/2015 is moved from 1:30pm to 8:30am.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Ronald Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-11-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Oral No Contact Order with the Big Lots retail store, the co-actors and the victims

No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Defendant Reginald L Tracy in court with Attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
